description._content: Description: The old native dance dress as still worn for the "roula" dance. Her ornaments of ovulum ovum shells are much prized. Her skirt is dyed black and made sleek with coconut oil. Location: Kiribati ------------------------------------------------------ Description: A modern dance dress as used for the new "batero" dance. Both the riri and the dance are recent innovations from the Ellice Islands. Location: Ellice Islands, Kiribati ------------------------------------------------------ Our Catalogue Reference: Part of CO 1069/642. This image is part of the Colonial Office photographic collection held at The National Archives. Feel free to share it within the spirit of the Commons. Please use the comments section below the pictures to share any information you have about the people, places or events shown. We have attempted to provide place information for the images automatically but our software may not have found the correct location. For high quality reproductions of any item from our collection please contact our image library
